A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: An amazing addition to the franchise. Bolstered by some of the best cinematography to grace the series\, The Last Jedi manages the incredible juggling act of balancing light homage to the original trilogy while deconstructing and rebuilding the themes that made it so memorable in the first place. Delivering outstanding set pieces and shots full of wonder and breathtaking contrast\, Rian Johnson becomes the first director since Irvin Kershner to breathe a truly unique vision into George Lucas' sprawling universe. While it has its faults\, the promise it paints for the future of the franchise is potent and full of hope.
